title: quarks-spring-cloud-config-client cannot take "profile" as a property which was supported by spring

labels.name: area/spring
labels.description: Issues relating to the Spring integration

body:
### Describe the bug

I have a rest service that accepts values from bootstrap.yml file for the spring-cloud-config-client to connect to our local Config server. Here is how it looks like:
```
spring:
  cloud:  
    config: 
      enabled: true
      uri: ${CONFIG-URII}
      username: ${CONFIG_USER}
      password: ${CONFIG_PASSWORD}
      name: ${APPNAME}
      profile: ${APPNAME}-${APP_PROFILE}
      label: ${CONFIG_LABEL}
      headers:
        access_token: ${CONFIG_TOKEN}
```
Now in the quarks-spring-cloud-config-client, the above properties need to come from the application.yml. 

In the above, the values of the APPNAME will be "my-rest-service" and APP_PROFILE would be "dev" and effectively, the profile passed would be "my-rest-service-dev".

With the properties "name" and "profile"removed in the quarks-spring-cloud-config. I cannot find a way to get the configuration from the config server for this profile "my-rest-service-dev". 

Would anyone please help resolve this issue?


### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

_No response_
